problem: A metal rod with a thickness of 0.01 m and a surface area of 2.0 m² conducts heat. Given the thermal conductivity of the rod is 0.5 W/mK and the temperature difference across the ends of the rod is 50°C, calculate the rate of heat transfer through the rod using Fourier’s Law of Heat Conduction.
Calculate the power radiated by a surface with an emissivity of 0.9 and a surface area of 1.5 m² at an absolute temperature of 500 K using the Stefan-Boltzmann Law.
An isolated system experiences a heat addition of 1500 J and does 500 J of work. Using the First Law of Thermodynamics, determine the change in internal energy of the system.
According to the Second Law of Thermodynamics, if body 1 is at 300 K and body 2 is at 100 K, can heat spontaneously flow from body 2 to body 1? Explain your answer.
